title: Narra
description: The National Tree of the Philippines, commonly found in Bukidnon plantations and farmlands.
medicinal: Bark decoction used for skin infections.

title: Molave
description: A durable hardwood tree abundant in the upland and plantation areas of Lantapan and nearby municipalities.
medicinal: Leaves boiled for fever and headaches.

title: Red Lauan
description: A dipterocarp species found in the Mt. Kitanglad Range Natural Park.
medicinal: Resin traditionally used to seal wounds.

title: White Lauan
description: Found in high-elevation forests such as Mt. Kalatungan and adjacent ranges.

title: Yakal
description: A slow-growing hardwood species occasionally found in southern Bukidnon forests (Maramag area).

title: Mangkono (Philippine Ironwood)
description: Rare ironwood that can occur in protected mountain areas around Manolo Fortich and northern Bukidnon ranges.

title: Kamagong
description: Philippine ebony growing in secondary and lowland forest patches near Malaybalay/Valencia corridors.

title: Banaba
description: A medicinal tree commonly found along rivers and roadsides in Valencia and nearby Quezon municipality.
medicinal: Leaves used for diabetes and kidney cleansing.

title: Lagundi
description: A common medicinal shrub/tree occurring on farm edges and secondary growth across Bukidnon.
medicinal: Used for cough, asthma, and colds.

title: Mindanao Cinnamon
description: An endemic cinnamon species found in upland forest patches around Lantapan and Kitanglad foothills.
medicinal: Bark used for stomachache and flu.

title: Mindanao Rainbow Gum
description: Rainbow eucalyptus found in moist plantation sites and riparian strips in eastern Bukidnon zones.

title: Balete
description: Large fig species present in lowland and riparian areas across Bukidnon (Maramag/Kitaotao corridor).
medicinal: Sap and leaves used for fungal infections.
